intro: Crepis fodorii, commonly known as the Hungarian mouse-ear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Carpathian Basin and grows in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Crepis fodorii is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
